alert name: Tioga and Glacier Point Winter Closures
description: Tioga Road (continuation of Highway 120 through the park) and Glacier Point Road are closed for the season due to snow. They will both reopen later than usual this summer. Call 209/372-0200 (then 1, 1) for road conditions and tire chain requirements.

alert name: Drakes Beach Road only open from 10 am to 4 pm due to elephant seal pups
description: To better protect elephant seal pups that are present adjacent to the parking lot at Drakes Beach, Drakes Beach Road is closed daily from 4 pm to 10 am, but will be open daily from 10 am to 4 pm when park staff and winter wildlife docents are present.

alert name: Drakes Beach Road only open from 10 am to 4 pm due to elephant seal pups
description: To better protect elephant seal pups that are present adjacent to the parking lot at Drakes Beach, Drakes Beach Road is closed daily from 4 pm to 10 am, but will be open daily from 10 am to 4 pm when park staff and winter wildlife docents are present.

alert name: Mount Vision Rd blocked by fallen trees due to the February 4, 2024, storm.

After snowstorms, the main park road shuts at mile marker 3 for snow removal. Closure duration varies based on storm impact. The Bryce Amphitheater area, including Bryce Point and others, is prioritized for plowing and remains accessible.

After snowstorms, the main park road shuts at mile marker 3 for snow removal. Closure duration varies based on storm impact. The Bryce Amphitheater area, including Bryce Point and others, is prioritized for plowing and remains accessible.

The road leading to Fairyland Point (1 mile) closes to vehicles the first Monday after Thanksgiving and remains closed through the winter season. The unplowed road remains open for hikers, snowshoers, and x-country skiers.

The road leading to Fairyland Point (1 mile) closes to vehicles the first Monday after Thanksgiving and remains closed through the winter season. The unplowed road remains open for hikers, snowshoers, and x-country skiers.

Due to winter weather, the 18-mile Main Road is temporarily closed to all traffic beyond Mile 10 (Farview Point). Closure durations depend on storm impacts and snowplow operations. The Bryce Amphitheater area of the park remains open to all vehicles.

Due to winter weather, the 18-mile Main Road is temporarily closed to all traffic beyond Mile 10 (Farview Point). Closure durations depend on storm impacts and snowplow operations. The Bryce Amphitheater area of the park remains open to all vehicles.

The road leading to Paria View (0.3 miles) closes to vehicles the first Monday after Thanksgiving and remains closed through the winter season. The unplowed road remains open for hikers, snowshoers, and x-country skiers.

alert name: Blasting and heavy construction at Park Headquarters
description: As part of the construction of the park's new maintenance building, the contractor will be blasting granite ledge beginning September 25. Warning whistles and blasting may be heard in the area of park headquarters located on Eagle Lake Road in Bar Harbor.

Follow orange detour signs labeled "TRACE". Parkway closed from Highway 32 (MP 239.2) to Highway 6 south of Tupelo, MS (MP 256.9) Scroll to the bottom of the linked page after clicking on the "more" link to view the map and turn-by-turn directions.
Mariposa Grove Road is closed October 16–27 for winter storm damage repairs (no shuttle or vehicle access).
Expect 30-minute delays, Monday through Friday, 6 am to 9 pm, for road repaving and repair.

alert name: Cima Road Closed to ALL VEHICLES due to Construction
description: Cima Road is undergoing a major renovation for visitor and wildlife safety upgrades. Please do not drive around barricades or cross this active construction zone.

alert name: Expect carriage road construction between intersections 10 and 11
description: Watch for heavy equipment and rough surfaces on carriage road between intersections 10 and 11 near Gilmore Meadow through October. Horses and carriages should avoid the area, which may be impassable at times. Bikers will need to dismount and walk.

alert name: Blasting and heavy construction at Park Headquarters
description: As part of the construction of the park's new maintenance building, the contractor will be blasting granite ledge beginning September 25. Warning whistles and blasting may be heard in the area of park headquarters located on Eagle Lake Road in Bar Harbor.

alert name: Carriage road closed to horses between intersections 14 and 21
description: A section of the historic carriage road system between intersections 14 and 21 is closed to horse use until further notice. Park staff are working to repair the Cliffside Bridge and the large machinery will make it unsafe for horses and riders.

A $10.1 million construction project to improve the Harpers Corner Road within Dinosaur National Monument. The project includes reconstruction and repaving of seven miles of roadway and adjacent parking areas from US Highway 40 to the Escalante Overlook.

Follow orange detour signs labeled "TRACE". Parkway closed from Highway 32 (MP 239.2) to Highway 6 south of Tupelo, MS (MP 256.9) Scroll to the bottom of the linked page after clicking on the "more" link to view the map and turn-by-turn directions.

Visitation to the Hoh Rain Forest is very popular during the summer months. Visitors should be prepared for 1-2 hour wait times at the entrance station between the hours of 10 AM and 5 PM. The parking lot fills early and then traffic is metered.

alert name: Hurricane Ridge Road will be closed beginning October 16 for demolition
description: Beginning on October 16, demolition and removal of the remaining Hurricane Ridge Day Lodge debris begins. This critical step in the ongoing efforts to restore visitor services and ensure public safety will require a temporary closure of the area.

alert name: Temporary Night Closures 10/29 - 11/3 Baker-Barry Tunnel Marin Headlands
description: Barry-Baker Tunnel will be closed from 10 pm to 6 am each night for maintenance. Visitors needing to enter or leave the Marin Headlands will be detoured to Conzelman and McCullough Roads. Flaggers and a pilot car will be used for traffic control.
